attributes.action: Credit Cards automatically disabled by the provider after 12 months of none use.
attributes.additional_details: I receive credit card statements through the post, for credit cards that I have not used for years. I try to cancel them but its always too much hassle or they convince me to keep the card, just in case. I don't even know what credit cards I have, but I do know they have been paid off with a zero balance. If all unused credit cards with zero balance were removed from the system this would decrease credit card fraud due to lesser amount of live credit cards.
attributes.background: With the increase in Credit Card fraud, I have concerns about the amount of currently active credit cards currently being unused. I think that all credit cards that have been cleared of any monies owing and not used within a 12 month period should be disabled by the provider.

rejection.details:
This is a decision for credit card providers to take.

If you would like Parliament to change the law so that credit card providers are required to do this, you could start a petition asking for that.
